messages.message: I’m getting `Could not import lzma module...` errors in a few services. How do I pull in new dependencies in python?
<!subteam^SPYBRCK6X>?
api-server-apps
I’m running pip install directly in that directory now
oh it might have to do with python virtual environments. are you using venv?
yes
It looks like a new dependency introduced in refiner V5 https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/18660. @Erick probably just missed adding it to the local requirements.txt files?
if you're running api-server-apps locally in it’s own terminal, you might need to run `source ~/Documents/venv3/bin/activate` from that terminal before running the build/run make commands
otherwise the python packages might not get installed to the correct location
Oh interesting… I thought lzma was built-in in the python language https://docs.python.org/3.7/library/lzma.html

@Travis if you type `python --version` what do you get? It needs to be at least `3.3` for `lzma` to exist. But I think a lot of other things would be breaking too if you were running an earlier version…
I think I’ve gotten around this now. I think the `ibstart` command isn’t working right
And do you get that error from `python -c "import lzma"`?
Hmm gotcha
and switching things to just use `make run-docker`
I also did a manual `pip install backsport.lzma`

Are you free for a quick zoom? Just want to see if this is going to be a problem multiple people run into. I was under the impression `lzma` was included in the basic python libraries (similar to `os` )
sure thing, ready when you are
jumping in here, would this be helpful? https://stackoverflow.com/a/61531555/13201682
thanks Arun, I’ll review

Yes I had to follow what @arun indicated last week. Issue likely seems pyenv and linking to lzma library. Since lzma py package is part of python, ended up needing to reinstall Python 3.7.3 and all libraries. Tried to set path to lzma lib and include files - but that did not work.
Let me know if you are trying this route, I can list down the steps I took to set it up again (esp with Big sur - adds own complications for Pyenv new setup)
